citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
A study related surgical procedure was performed on six rhesus macaques on June 26, 2024. These macaques were
under a holding protocol (IPROTO202400000016) in which surgery was not approved. The Principal Investigator (PI) had
requested their transfer to the protocol under which the surgical procedure was IACUC approved. However, the animals
had not yet been transferred to the study protocol prior to the PI conducting the procedures. No adverse events were
reported during the surgeries and the animals were recovered successfully.
This activity constitutes a significant deviation from the approved activities in the protocol. Principal investigators are to
follow the IACUC approved proposals, and any proposed changes shall be reviewed and approved by the IACUC prior to
implementation.
This incident was reported in the IACUC meeting minutes and corrective measures, including verifying that protocol
transfers are complete, had been implemented prior to inspection. To remain corrected after February 28, 2025.

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
Sodium chloride that had expired on August 31, 2024, was administered to a rhesus macaque by veterinary staff on
September 27, 2024. No adverse effects were reported from the administration of this expired compound.
An expired compound may not be safe or effective and is not an appropriate method for the treatment or prevention of
animal health issues. The facility must ensure that methods of treatment, including the medications maintained for use in
animals, are appropriate.
This incident was reported in the IACUC meeting minutes and corrective measures, including checking expiration dates
each month and at point-of-care, had been implemented prior to inspection. To remain corrected after February 28, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
